message.content:
cs.GR, cs.CV, cs.MM, cs.HC, cs.LG. 

The paper focuses on real-time performance capture of humans under motion, which involves computer graphics and computer vision techniques. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.GR (Computer Graphics). The paper also proposes a deep architecture for completion, super resolution, and denoising of imagery, which falls under the category of cs.CV (Computer Vision). Additionally, the paper mentions the use of virtual and augmented reality headsets, which could be classified under cs.MM (Multimedia). The system is designed for user experience, which could be categorized under cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction). Finally, the paper proposes a self-supervised training method and a salient reweighing scheme, which could be classified under cs.LG (Machine Learning).
